title: Deli Manager
description:
The Fresh Market & You

Our mission is to make everyday eating extraordinary for our guests, and we are looking for a new team member who will commit to helping us deliver on this mission.

Our Added Benefits For Joining The Fresh Market Team

Team Member discount of 30% Early Earn Wage Access (You can access up to 50% (max $500) of your earned wages on-demand per pay period)401K contribution and company matchFinancial Wellness ProgramPersonal time off and additional time off purchase plans are availableMedical, Dental, Vision, Disability, and Life Insurance for individual, spouse, partner, and familyDiscounts on pet insurance, daycare, event tickets, and many more.

About The Position

As the Deli Manager, you are taking the lead in directing team members, managing department inventory, pricing integrity, training, and other operational processes that require significant attention to detail. This is a fast-paced position that requires efficiency, effectiveness, and a passion for excellence to drive results.

What You'll Do

Greeting guests and proactively assisting them in a friendly manner with accurate and timely information Making recommendations and accommodating requests Managing order guides/ordering deadlines/reducing shrink/damage Properly receiving/stocking of goods that follow rotation standards when replenishing product levels Direct teams to handle, slice and prepare a variety of the department’s meat, cheeses, and Convenient Meal Solutions (CMS) throughout the day Engage, motivate, coach, and train team members “on-the-job” as well as through The Fresh Market’s internal training platform to provide excellent guest service in a safe and secure manner 

Availability:

This position requires the willingness to work a flexible schedule, including weekends, days, evenings, and holidays. 

Qualifications

At a minimum, what you’ll need:

High School Diploma or equivalent and 3 years of management experience in retail, restaurant, or hospitality field or 5 years of related management experience Ability to read, understand and follow planograms, layouts, and schematics of the department for merchandising Working knowledge of Microsoft Office Must be at least 18 years old

We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer:

The Fresh Market is a proud, equal-opportunity employer that is committed to creating a diverse, equitable, and inclusive workplace. 

Reasonable Accommodation: Consistent with applicable laws, The Fresh Market will provide reasonable accommodations for qualified applicants and team members, unless doing so would result in an undue hardship to The Fresh Market. This guiding principle applies to all aspects of employment, including hiring and job assignment, compensation, discipline, termination, and access to benefits and training. 

The statements in this job posting describe the general nature and level of work expected in this role but are not all-inclusive. The Fresh Market looks forward to talking with interested candidates to share additional details about the applicable responsibilities, duties, and skills required

title: Brand Initiatives Manager, Extended Stay (Hybrid)
description:
Who are we looking for?

Choice Hotels, one of the world’s largest lodging franchisors, has an exciting new opportunity as our Brand Initiatives Manager in the Extended Stay Strategy Division. The Extended Stay Strategy Division is a forward-thinking, cross-functional team with a dedicated focus on developing, leading and executing strategies for Choice’s four Extended Stay brands—Everhome Suites, MainStay Suites, Suburban Studios and WoodSpring Suites. As a key member of our Extended Stay Strategy Division, you will focus on developing and implementing innovative strategies to elevate our brand presence and drive growth, further differentiating Choice from the competition.

If you are a strategic thinker with a tactical mindset, possess a high sense of urgency, and excel at critical thinking and problem-solving, we invite you to apply today for our Brand Initiatives Manager role and #MakeItYourChoice.

Your Responsibilities

Manage the execution of Extended Stay programs and brand strategy initiatives.Communicate execution progress to Extended Stay membership team and key stakeholders.Collaborate with Brand teams as needed to plan and execute communication strategies and other elements necessary for successful implementation of brand initiatives.Support the development and execution of consumer and/or operational testing and appropriate measurement mechanisms: focusing on owner ROI (return on investment), RevPAR (revenue per available room), LTR (likelihood to recommend – guest satisfaction), and unit growth.Develop reports and presentations for internal and external meetings, including executive business reviews, owner advisory councils, and annual events and meetings.

Your Experience, Skills & Competencies

Bachelor's degree required.A hospitality professional with broad hotel operations knowledge and familiarity with a variety of hospitality industry concepts, practices, and procedures strongly preferred.Prior exposure to extended stay brands in a brand or operational role preferred.Strong project management experience, (preferably PMP certification), with experience developing project management plans, implementing initiatives, and measuring results.Strong organizational, time-management and analytical skills.Ability to communicate successfully with peers, management, and Franchisees / General Managers.Excellent verbal, written and organizational skills.Flexibility to changing priorities and ability to handle multiple tasks concurrently.Strong written and verbal communication skills.Exercises independent judgment and creativity to solve problems.Willingness to explore opportunities to add value to any given project.Ability to leverage data and create a foundation of data-supported decision making.Proficient in the use of MS Office applications, such as Outlook, Word, Excel, PowerPoint.

Your Team

This is an individual contributor role that will report to the Director, Brand Activation - Extended Stay. You will collaborate with cross functional departments on a regular basis.

Your Work Location

As our Brand Initiatives Manager, you will be based in our beautiful, state-of-the-art worldwide corporate headquarters in North Bethesda, MD. Less than 15 miles from Washington, DC, we’re located one block away from the North Bethesda Metro station, with service on the Red Line and the MARC Brunswick line, easy access to I-270, and plenty of free parking provided by Choice Hotels.

Right now, our associates in corporate headquarters are working in a hybrid environment, up to 4 days per week in the office and virtually from your home office the remaining days. We provide flexibility and encourage ongoing communication with your leadership to establish expectations about your unique needs.

About Choice

Choice Hotels International, Inc. (NYSE: CHH) is one of the largest lodging franchisors in the world. With nearly 7,500 hotels, representing nearly 630,000 rooms, in 46 countries and territories as of September 30, 2022, the Choice® family of hotel brands provides business and leisure travelers with a range of high-quality lodging options from limited service to full-service hotels in the upper upscale, upper mid-scale, midscale, extended-stay, and economy segments. The award-winning Choice Privileges® loyalty program offers members a faster way to rewards, with personalized benefits starting on day one. For more information, visit www.choicehotels.com.

At our worldwide corporate headquarters in North Bethesda, MD and St. Louis Park, MN as well as our technology center in Scottsdale, AZ, and through our associates around the globe, we keep Choice Hotels thriving by serving as a champion for our franchisees and providing cutting-edge technology.

About Choice Hotels Financial Performance

Record total revenues grew 10% to $1.5 billion for full-year 2023 compared to the same period of 2022. Adjusted EBITDA for fourth quarter 2023 increased 11% to $125 million from the same period of 2022. Fourth quarter 2023 adjusted diluted EPS increased 14% to $1.44 compared to the same period of 2022. Please click here to review highlights of our Fourth Quarter and Full-Year 2023 Results.

 PLEASE NOTE: This role is not eligible for sponsorship ***

Ability to model Choice’s Cultural Values: Welcome and Respect Everyone, Be Bold, Be Quick, Listen, Be Curious and Show Integrity.

title: Scientist IV, QC Development & Lifecycle
description:
Job Title: Scientist IV, QC Development & Lifecycle

Location: Columbus, OH

Job Type: Full time

Req ID: 5763

About Us:

As a developer, manufacturer, and supplier of essential medicines, Hikma Pharmaceuticals USA Inc. and its affiliates’ mission is to bring Better Health. Within Reach. Every Day.® for millions of patients around the world. We are a trusted, reliable partner and dependable source of over 750 high-quality generic, specialty and branded pharmaceutical products that hospitals, physicians and pharmacists need to treat their patients across North America, the Middle East, North Africa and Europe. Through our 32 manufacturing plants, eight R&D centers, and 8,500+ employees worldwide, we are always hard at work creating high-quality medicines and making them accessible to the people who need them.

Description:

We are committed to building a diverse and inclusive team and encourage applications from candidates of all backgrounds. We are seeking a talented and motivated Scientist IV, QC Development & Lifecycle to join our team. In this role, you will be responsible for Managing highly technical analytical projects in support of new products analysis, development and validation in order to facilitate a consistent and compliant approach. Conducting analytical method development, testing and validation in support of regulatory submissions and new product launches. Providing peer leadership, mentoring and decision-making for various laboratory studies in support of ANDA/NDA applications and/or application updates (validation, verification, equivalency, etc.). You will work closely with Staff, project managers, leadership, support groups such as technical services, operations, and laboratory support teams such as ChemStore, GMP Metrology, LabWare, etc. and API suppliers, CMO customers, FDA, USP, etc.

Key Responsibilities:

 Develops with little to no supervision and validates analytical procedures to meet SOPs, ICH, JP, EP, USP, EMEA, and FDA requirements; performs analytical transfers for multi-source and brand products internally and externally. Organizes study data to assist/write technical reports.  Takes the lead on assigned highly technical projects with little to no supervision to facilitate analytical method development, testing, validation and project support for alternative API and business development projects. Using project planning tools, identifies, offers, and implements contingency plans to prevent and overcome analytical issues and perform analytical procedure trouble shooting with little to no supervision.  Performs qualitative, quantitative, developmental, chemical and physical testing for highly technical projects as specified by compendia (USP, JP, BP), regulatory authority (FDA & ICH) for starting materials, packaging components, intermediates and finished products.  Follows work instructions, SOPs, company practices and regulatory guidances/regulations. Documents analytical activities and results accurately, in a timely manner and right-first time. Reviews and checks analytical data generated by peers and maintains integrity of data. Supports activities to maintain the laboratory status of compliance to FDA/regulatory standards.  Proactively participates in activities in support of process changes (e.g. processes, procedures, etc...). Suggests and leads process improvements to refine current systems and improve efficiency. Mentors peers in method development, validation, troubleshooting, instrumentation, laboratory practices, and processes. Conducts trainings on selected topics of interest for the department  Communicates effectively with peers, supervisor, management and internal/external customers about project status. Monitors project status and proactively communicate to supervisor potential delays and challenges, along with a path forward. Participates and represents the department in cross-functional teams. 


Skills

 Possess excellent written and verbal communication skills, technical writing, organizational, leadership and presentation skills  The candidate must have the ability to work with minimal supervision using scientific judgment and professional competency.  Demonstrated ability to develop and manage multiple short and long-term projects from start to completion.  Ability to plan short- and long-term capacity models to support project execution (preferably in an application such as Microsoft Project)  Experience with data acquisition software. 


Qualifications:

We value the skills and experiences candidates bring to the table. While we have listed some qualifications below, we encourage candidates to apply even if they do not meet all of them: 

 Minimum:   B.S. degree in a scientific discipline such as chemistry, pharmacy  Must possess a specialized knowledge of ICH and FDA guidances, technology transfer requirements, method development and validation, technical writing and submission documents, and instrumentation with a GxP and regulatory emphasis  Preferred:  M.S. or Ph.D. degree in a scientific discipline such as chemistry, pharmacy 

 

 EXPERIENCE  Minimum:    For B.S degree – Ten (10) years of laboratory experience in a pharmaceutical or highly regulated environment  For M.S. degree – Six (6) years of laboratory experience in a pharmaceutical or highly regulated environment  For Ph.D. degree – Five (5) years of laboratory experience in a pharmaceutical or highly regulated environment  K nowledge of Quality/GMP relevant regulations, ICH, and FDA guidances, method validation principles, and method development  Know ledge in chromatographic applications such as HPLC, GC, and UV-Vis, as well as dissolution, laser diffraction particle sizing, and titrations  Knowledge in support of NDA and ANDA regulatory submissions for multiple dosage forms  Preferred:  In-depth knowledge of the critical functions/variables of the analytical techniques, and proven ability to troubleshoot analytical procedures.  In depth knowledge of current FDA/ICH guidances, national pharmacopoeias, cGMP regulations and analytical regulatory requirements for ANDA/NDA submissions.  Experience working in a team environment approach to accomplish tasks assigned using proven coaching skills.  Experience working on multiple tasks in a fast pace environment. Project management and organizational skills are required.  Experience in mass spectrometry applications  Experience in nasal spray dosage forms, including actuation performance tests such as pump delivery, spray content uniformity, spray pattern, plume geometry, actuation force, etc. 

What We Offer*:

 Annual performance bonus, commission, and share potential  Auto enrollment in a Hikma-sponsored 401(k) program at a pre-tax contribution rate of 3% of eligible pay. Hikma will match 100% of the first 6% of eligible pay that you contribute  A generous paid time off (PTO) bank starting with 20 days (prorated based on hire date). Additional days granted upon reaching work milestone anniversaries  3 personal days (prorated based on hire date)  11 company paid holidays  Comprehensive benefits including health, dental, vision, mental health, disability, life insurance, prescription drug coverage, and a variety of voluntary benefits  Employee discount program  Wellbeing rewards program  Safety and Quality is a top organizational priority  Career advancement and growth opportunities  Tuition reimbursement  Paid maternity and parental leave Eligibility requirements apply to some benefits and depend on the job classification, role, and length of employment. Benefits are subject to change as well as specific plan or program terms.


Equal Opportunity Employer:

Hikma Pharmaceuticals USA Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status, or other characteristics protected by law.

title: Social Media Communications Designer
description:
Description:
A social media & Communications Designer provides the creative execution of all outward facing collateral and messaging. This includes social media posts, catalogs, marketing material, sales deck templates, corporate identity and experiential environments (trade booths). The position requires a person to be a very visual storyteller who can deliver a message in a multitude of ways. They should be social media obsessed and stay on top of all current trends and platforms. They possess the ability to design for digital and traditional print. The role requires one to be a “self-starter” and proactive in trying new ways to reach our audience and influence our buyers. 
Objectives of this Role:
Deliver a meaningful message to our audience in multiple platforms and materials. Significantly Expand our followers and audience.Deliver impactful sales and marketing collateral on time.Create entertaining and on brand content.Design and plan trade exhibit spaceCollaborate with Brand Managers in designing materials needed to deliver to right message.Collaborate with other KP Creatives on style guides and visual identity systems.
Specific Responsibilities:
Manage the Kids Preferred social media sites Instagram, Facebook and TikTok. Develop meaningful creative and entertaining content for Kids Preferred and their third-party brands. Design annual product catalogs, mini-brand catalogs, sales sheets, and collateral.Design trade booth, manage trade show communication and execution.Create visual graphics for promotional materials and corporate signage.
Qualifications:
3 years’ experience4-year college degree in Visual Communications, Design or Multi-MediaStrong design skillset, creative problem solver, can do attitude, proficient in Adobe Design SuiteDeep knowledge of social media platforms, printing methods and project planning/scheduling 
Day in the Life of:
Daily Tasks:
Uploading creative storytelling social media posts celebrating any of our brands and product programs.Design catalog, sales and marketing collateral layouts.Meeting with various Brand teams to discuss upcoming events and messaging needs.Exploring new ways to build and expand our social media following.Filming, taking pictures and creating new content. 
Reporting Responsibilities:
Social media analytics
Benefits:
Medical, Dental and Vision InsuranceEmployee Basic Life and AD&D Insurance401K Retirement ProgramShort- & long-term disabilityPaid time off (vacation, sick, personal)Summer FridaysRemote Hybrid schedule.

title: Laboratory Technician
description:
Job Req ID: 113598

Laboratory Technician

We are seeking a Laboratory Technician to follow routine protocols under the close supervision of a faculty investigator or a senior technician. Will perform laboratory tests utilizing requisite lab equipment and instruments, making minor adjustments as required. Responsible for laboratory maintenance, preparing solutions and media, and ordering supplies. May be responsible for the care of laboratory animals.

Specific Duties & Responsibilities

 Performs routine bioinformatics and laboratory analysis and tests such as; PCR, DNA purification, and next-generation sequencing. Responsible for laboratory and clinical data entry and information retrieval from multiple online databases. Operates requisite laboratory equipment and instruments; records data; maintains and makes minor adjustments to equipment. Prepares solutions, reagents, and stains following standard laboratory formulas and procedures. Prepares, cleans, sterilizes, and maintains laboratory equipment, glassware, and instruments used in research experiments.


Minimum Qualifications

High School Diploma or graduation equivalent with some science coursework.


Preferred Qualifications

Certificate from technical institute or internship experience.Training Certificate from Technical Institute.


Classified Title: Laboratory Technician

Role/Level/Range: ACRO40/E/02/CB

Starting Salary Range: $15.25 - $23.00 HRLY ($19.12/hr. targeted; Commensurate with experience)

Employee group: Casual / On Call

Schedule: Varies

Exempt Status: Non-Exempt

Location: School of Medicine Campus

Department name: SOM Onc Urologic Oncology

Personnel area: School of Medicine

Total Rewards

The referenced salary range is based on Johns Hopkins University’s good faith belief at the time of posting. Actual compensation may vary based on factors such as geographic location, work experience, market conditions, education/training and skill level. Johns Hopkins offers a total rewards package that supports our employees' health, life, career and retirement. More information can be found here: https://hr.jhu.edu/benefits-worklife/.

Please refer to the job description above to see which forms of equivalency are permitted for this position. If permitted, equivalencies will follow these guidelines: JHU Equivalency Formula: 30 undergraduate degree credits (semester hours) or 18 graduate degree credits may substitute for one year of experience. Additional related experience may substitute for required education on the same basis. For jobs where equivalency is permitted, up to two years of non-related college course work may be applied towards the total minimum education/experience required for the respective job.

Applicants who do not meet the posted requirements but are completing their final academic semester/quarter will be considered eligible for employment and may be asked to provide additional information confirming their academic completion date.


The successful candidate(s) for this position will be subject to a pre-employment background check. Johns Hopkins is committed to hiring individuals with a justice-involved background, consistent with applicable policies and current practice. A prior criminal history does not automatically preclude candidates from employment at Johns Hopkins University. In accordance with applicable law, the university will review, on an individual basis, the date of a candidate's conviction, the nature of the conviction and how the conviction relates to an essential job-related qualification or function.

The Johns Hopkins University values diversity, equity and inclusion and advances these through our key strategic framework, the JHU Roadmap on Diversity and Inclusion.

Equal Opportunity Employer

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.

EEO Is The Law

For TTY users, call via Maryland Relay or dial 711. For more information about workplace accommodations or accessibility at Johns Hopkins University, please visit https://accessibility.jhu.edu/.

title: Principal Software Engineer
description:
SS&C is a global provider of investment and financial services and software for the financial services and healthcare industries. Named to Fortune 1000 list as top U.S. company based on revenue, SS&C is headquartered in Windsor, Connecticut and has 20,000+ employees in over 90 offices in 35 countries. Some 18,000 financial services and healthcare organizations, from the world's largest institutions to local firms, manage and account for their investments using SS&C's products and services.

Job Description

Location(s): Boston, MA | Waltham, MA | Hybrid

Get To Know the Team: 

Eze Eclipse™ is a born-in-the-cloud investment solution that supports start-up, emerging equity-, and event-focused hedge funds’ full investment process in a single, unified platform through a secure web browser interface.

As a Principal Software Engineer on the platform services team, you will play a key role in architecting, designing, and implementing the core infrastructure that powers the Eclipse™ family of products and services. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams of engineers, designers, and product managers to ensure the scalability, reliability, and performance of the platform, enabling us to deliver exceptional user experiences to our rapidly growing customer base.

The mission of the platform services team is to provide a suite of reusable software components which enable all Eclipse™ engineering teams to build microservices that meet our requirements for scalability, testability, and observability in a highly automated CI/CD environment.

Why You Will Love It Here! 

Flexibility: Hybrid Work Model & a Business Casual Dress Code, including jeans Your Future: 401k Matching Program, Professional Development Reimbursement Work/Life Balance: Flexible Personal/Vacation Time Off, Sick Leave, Paid Holidays Your Wellbeing: Medical, Dental, Vision, Employee Assistance Program, Parental Leave Diversity & Inclusion: Committed to Welcoming, Celebrating and Thriving on Diversity Training: Hands-On, Team-Customized, including SS&C University Extra Perks: Discounts on fitness clubs, travel and more! 

What You Will Get To Do: 

Lead the design and development of scalable, highly available, and performant platform components, services, and RESTful APIsCollaborate with cross-functional teams to define technical requirements, create architectural designs, and implement innovative solutionsMentor and guide team members, providing technical leadership, code reviews, and promoting best practices to foster a culture of continuous improvementDrive the adoption of modern software engineering practices, tools, and methodologiesParticipate in architectural discussions and contribute to the overall Eclipse™ technical roadmapIdentify and address performance bottlenecks, security vulnerabilities, and other system limitationsKeep up to date with industry trends and emerging technologies, identifying relevant advancements, and using them to enhance the platform’s capabilities, as appropriate

What You Will Bring: 

Bachelor's or master's degree in computer science, software engineering, or a related field8+ years of software development experience, with a focus on building and scaling complex, distributed systemsProficiency in multiple programming languages such as C#, C++, JavaScript, Java, Go, Python, etcSolid understanding of microservices architecture, containerization (Docker, Kubernetes), and one or more public cloud technologies (e.g., AWS, Azure, GCP)Proven track record of designing and implementing RESTful APIs, GraphQL APIs and web servicesStrong problem-solving skills, with the ability to diagnose and resolve complex technical challengesExcellent oral and written communication skills and the ability to work effectively in a collaborative team environmentExperience with agile development methodologies and CI/CD pipelines Prior experience in a technical leadership or mentorship role is a plus

Thank you for your interest in SS&C! To further explore this opportunity, please apply through our careers page on the corporate website at www.ssctech.com/careers.

Unless explicitly requested or approached by SS&C Technologies, Inc. or any of its affiliated companies, the company will not accept unsolicited resumes from headhunters, recruitment agencies, or fee-based recruitment services. SS&C offers excellent benefits including health, dental, 401k plan, tuition and professional development reimbursement plan. SS&C Technologies is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer and does not discriminate against any applicant for employment or employee on the basis of race, color, religious creed, gender, age, marital status, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, veteran status or any other classification protected by applicable discrimination laws.

title: Policy Search Analyst
description:
Resolute Management, Inc. is a Third-Party Administrator hired by clients to handle complex environmental, asbestos, and/or latent type insurance claims. We are proud to be an affiliate of the Berkshire Hathaway group of insurance companies and we believe our structure allows our employees to experience the benefits of a large company with a friendly, small company atmosphere. Our headquarters are in Boston, MA, and we have additional offices located in Chicago, Philadelphia, and Stamford, CT. 
POSITION SUMMARY:
Located in the Boston office, our Policy Search Analysts play a major role in supporting the manager of our policy search unit. A significant aspect of our claim and litigation support work involves detailed, complex research to locate evidence of liability insurance policies, particularly in the context of environmental and asbestos claims. The ideal candidate will possess outstanding organizational skills, attention to detail, strong communication skills, and the ability to handle multiple priorities, meet aggressive deadlines, and work with minimal supervision.
DUTIES: 
Analyze, investigate, and evaluate information provided by the Claims organization in order to properly initiate and manage policy searches.Works with multiple policy search teams to find copies or other evidence of alleged policies where appropriate.Excellent word processing and spreadsheet skills are required to effectively summarize and communicate search result findings.Takes initiative and has the ability to manage daily schedules with multiple deadlines.Possesses the interpersonal skills necessary to communicate with a diverse group of adjusters, attorneys, and clients. Effectively and efficiently summarizes a large amount of information in order to document search findings and identify any deficiencies to be addressed.Provides and obtains information and performs tasks with courtesy and respect.Maintains knowledge of policy search processes and procedures. 
PERFORMANCE REQUIREMENTS:
Possesses ability to draft, transcribe and interpret detailed, complex written communications.Demonstrates verbal and written communication skills including proper grammar usage and imparting information in a clear and concise manner.Possesses strong interpersonal skills and the desire and aptitude to learn new concepts.Maintains the ability to meet assigned deadlines.Promptly responds to inquiries with a sense of urgency.Performs well in a collaborative and cooperative office environment.Demonstrates ability to multi-task and effectively deal with interruptions.Follows instructions and established procedures.Proficiency with MS Word, Excel, and internet applications.Able to work under pressure and execute good judgment in sensitive situations.Ability to lift and move boxes on occasion, which may weigh up to 30lbs.
EDUCATION:
Bachelor’s degree required.
EXPERIENCE:
Minimum of two years in an employment environment demonstrating the performance requirements set forth above preferred. 
Job Type: Full-time

title: Sales Assistant Manager
description:
Rent A Center

Includes Quality Control, Quality Assurance, and Quality SystemsExperience related to planning and managing information technology projects and processes.Knowledge of and experience with the processes and procedures used to manage vendor relations, including sourcing, and negotiating with outside vendors in a business environmentExperience managing project and product scope, including identifying deliverables and goals to help mitigate changes to a projectExperience organizing and facilitating meetings, including creating agendas, guiding discussions, and reviewing outcomesExperience creating documentation to communicate technical processes and informationScaling framework which enables the implementation of Agile and Lean practices at an enterprise levelPMP or PMI certifications

title: Senior Data Operations Analyst
description:
Job Description

Job Purpose

ICE Data Services, a subsidiary of ICE, has an exciting opportunity within our Market Data Rights Management team. The Market Data Rights Management team is responsible for the management of third-party market data usage and distribution rights within the organization, ensuring that market data is administered in accordance with the licensing obligations of third-party market data sources as well as internal business rules and policies.

Responsibilities

Analyze complex third-party market data source contracts, policy documents and price lists and present summarized, standardized documentation on distribution rights via information repositories and systems. Process source mandated changes to policies and pricing by updating documentation, maintaining internal systems, and preparing materials to communicate changes both internally and externally to clients. Use knowledge of third-party market data licensing rules to advise on any third-party source risk associated with new ICE product launches or enhancements. Work with Product groups to reduce risks and manage third-party source outreach for new product sign-off where relevant. Assess prospect customer use-cases that fall outside of ICE’s standardized and approved use-cases and approve on a case-by-case basis. Review and resolve inquiries related to usage policies, pricing and billing issues, as well as entitlement system administration. Support the external audit defense team by providing distribution rights information, both current and historical. Assist with researching audit related inquiries. Use third-party market data and ICE product knowledge to define and prioritize compliance related projects. 

Knowledge And Experience

Experience in market data industry, including compliance and contract management background. Familiarity with real time, end-of-day and Non-Display use cases. Ability to analyze complex policy data (contracts and policy documents, fee schedules, new rule announcements) to identify adjustments to current systems and processes. Highly effective written and verbal communication skills. Strong analytical and problem-solving skills. Proficiency in the standard Microsoft Office suite (Excel, Word, Access); knowledge of Microsoft Visio a plus. Ability to learn new software applications and systems. Adept at creating and maintaining effective relationships through strong interpersonal skills. 

Schedule

This role offers work from home flexibility of up to 2 days per week.

Intercontinental Exchange, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin or ancestry, age, disability or veteran status, or other protected status.

title: Manager, Manufacturing Art
description:
Responsibilities

Job Description

Develop art separations optimized for efficient production screen print output, maximizing equipment capabilities and adaptability to changes. This includes creating separations suitable for multiple colorways and silhouettes.Lead and mentor a team of production artists, emphasizing expertise in manufacturing-ready art separations to uphold product integrity and quality control.Collaborate with stakeholders to review and refine production art processes, focusing on optimizing artwork for seamless manufacturing while maintaining product quality standards.Proactively identify process efficiencies and address performance and process gaps to enhance manufacturing readiness and ensure product quality.Oversee the hiring, training, and organization of internal and external production art teams, ensuring alignment with manufacturing requirements and quality control procedures.Manage team supervisors to ensure timely delivery of high-quality production art that meets department goals, KPIs, and product quality standards.Prioritize and plan production art projects, ensuring proper execution, delivery, and adherence to manufacturing standards without compromising product integrity.Facilitate communication and collaboration with cross-functional partners to effectively meet manufacturing needs while upholding product quality and integrity.Cultivate a strong workplace culture aligned with the company's core values, fostering creativity, collaboration, and a commitment to product excellence among team members.Utilize licensed trademarks and style guides to develop production-ready artwork compliant with brand standards, while maintaining a focus on manufacturing feasibility and product quality.Collaborate with web-based tools to manage a vast catalog of on-demand consumer products, ensuring manufacturing feasibility and product quality standards are met.

Requirements

Bachelor’s degree in Business, Merchandising, Manufacturing, or related field, or equivalent work experience.6+ years of experience in supply chain operations, project management, retail, or wholesale, with a focus on manufacturing-ready art separations and product quality control.2+ years of people management experience, preferably within an in-house art team environment.Proficiency in Adobe Illustrator, Photoshop, InDesign, CorelDRAW, and other design software, with a strong understanding of vector and PNG file formats.Working knowledge of Screen Printing and Direct-To-Garment processes, with experience in graphic design for manufacturability and product quality.Intermediate skill level in MS Excel, Word, PowerPoint, and Outlook, with familiarity in data warehouses and database management.Excellent time management skills and the ability to work under pressure to meet tight manufacturing deadlines while ensuring product integrity and quality.Passion for sports and licensed brands is a plus.Ability to travel up to 15% for job-related purposes.

If you're passionate about creating manufacturing-ready artwork that not only dazzles but also upholds the highest standards of product integrity and quality, we'd love to hear from you. Apply now to become a vital part of our innovative team!

About Us

Fanatics is building a leading global digital sports platform. The company ignites the passions of global sports fans and maximizes the presence and reach for hundreds of sports partners globally by offering innovative products and services across Fanatics Commerce, Fanatics Collectibles, and Fanatics Betting & Gaming, allowing sports fans to Buy, Collect and Bet. Through the Fanatics platform, sports fans can buy licensed fan gear, jerseys, lifestyle and streetwear products, headwear, and hardgoods; collect physical and digital trading cards, sports memorabilia, and other digital assets; and bet as the company builds its Sportsbook and iGaming platform. Fanatics has an established database of over 100 million global sports fans, a global partner network with over 900 sports properties, including major national and international professional sports leagues, teams, players associations, athletes, celebrities, colleges, and college conferences, and over 2,000 retail locations, including its Lids retail business stores. 

As a market leader with more than 18,000 employees, and hundreds of partners, suppliers, and vendors worldwide, we take responsibility for driving toward more ethical and sustainable practices. We are committed to building an inclusive Fanatics community, reflecting and representing society at every level of the business, including our employees, vendors, partners and fans. Fanatics is also dedicated to making a positive impact in the communities where we all live, work, and play through strategic philanthropic initiatives.

Organization

Fanatics Commerce is a leading designer, manufacturer, and seller of licensed fan gear, jerseys, lifestyle and streetwear products, headwear, and hardgoods. It operates a vertically-integrated platform of digital and physical capabilities for leading sports leagues, teams, colleges, and associations globally – as well as its flagship site, www.fanatics.com.

Fanatics Commerce has a broad range of online, sports venue, and vertical apparel partnerships worldwide, including comprehensive partnerships with leading leagues, teams, colleges, and sports organizations across the world—including the NFL, NBA, MLB, NHL, MLS, Formula 1, and Australian Football League (AFL); the Dallas Cowboys, Golden State Warriors, Paris Saint-Germain, Manchester United, Chelsea FC, and Tokyo Giants; the University of Notre Dame, University of Alabama, and University of Texas; the International Olympic Committee (IOC), England Rugby, and the Union of European Football Associations (UEFA).

title: Real Estate Agent - Pilsen/Bronzeville
description:
Join the ranks of Redfin’s top-producing real estate agents and get the best of both worlds: highly competitive commissions coupled with Redfin.com customers, benefits and support!

Maximize your earnings by plugging into the Redfin platform and nation’s #1 brokerage site, which gets 52 million monthly visitors and 600 million luxury listing views each year. We offer our agents progressive commissions: the more you sell, the more you keep from your Redfin-generated and loyalty customers. And since Redfin covers your business expenses, what you earn is what you keep.

Customer Opportunities + Support

Redfin agents have everything they need to reach more qualified buyers and win listings.

Redfin.com customers: You’ll get 100 new customers each year from Redfin, in addition to helping clients already in your sphere or book of business.Technology: Our proprietary CRM helps you manage your deals and stay in touch with your whole pipeline, alerting you when someone might be ready to make another move.Support: You’ll get support from a dedicated transaction coordinator, listing coordinator, and a team of showing agents. Our inside sales team qualifies opportunities and books them directly on your calendar. They handle many details for events, like organizing showing appointments and letting you know when and where to show up.

Earn More Money

Redfin Agents Earn Competitive Commissions On Their Closed Deals, With Unlimited Upside! Commissions Vary By Deal Source With Higher Splits Awarded For Repeat Redfin Clients

Competitive splits: Redfin Agents earn competitive commissions on the revenue of their closed deals, and there are no limits on the amount you can earn. Splits vary by deal source (Agent-generated or Redfin-generated) and higher commission splits are awarded for your repeat Redfin clients.In-year accelerators: opportunity to unlock higher commissions through an in-year commission accelerator that lasts the remainder of the year, if you hit a specified sales volume thresholdTop producer perks: earn a President’s Club trip to an international destination, qualify for stock grants and get exclusive access to represent clients buying and selling high-priced homes through our luxury brand

Reap The Perks

Everything you need, none of the hassle.

Zero agent fees: We pay all of the necessary costs of doing business, including state license and MLS dues, association fees, mileage, cell phone plan, and more.Healthcare, 401K, and more: Our generous benefits package includes medical, dental, vision, and insurance benefits, flexible spending account, health savings account, life and disability insurance, fertility benefits, commuter benefits, Employee Assistance Programs; and 401(k) employer match.Paid vacation: Accrue up to 15 days your first year. Plus, Redfin pays a fellow agent to cover your business while you’re away, so you can truly take a vacation.

Who You Are

We’re looking for the best agents who put clients first and are driven to win in their career.

Active and unrestricted real estate license You’ve closed a minimum of 15 residential sales over the last two years (excluding leases)You are a trusted advisor with in-depth experience leading clients through the home buying and selling process.You have a proven track record of winning web leads and clients over, closing deals and earning referral business.You have excellent interpersonal communication and customer service skillsYou embrace technology to build your business and collaborate efficiently

The compensation information below is provided in compliance with all applicable job posting disclosure requirements. This is a commission-based role with unlimited upside. Commissions in this role are expected to range from $35K to $555K. Redfin offers a generous benefits package that includes 15 paid vacation days, 12 paid holidays, paid parental leave, sick leave, and flex days; medical, dental, and vision insurance benefits; flexible spending account, health savings account, life and disability insurance; fertility benefits, commuter benefits, Employee Assistance Programs; and 401(k) employer match.

Redfin is an equal opportunity employer committed to hiring a diverse workforce.

A diverse, inclusive culture is vital to Redfin's mission of making real estate better for people from all walks of life. We’re proud that Redfin is a place where different points of view and backgrounds are encouraged and respected. We constantly strive to build a company that reflects the world around us, based on our conviction that pursuing and developing talent of all types is the right way for a business to thrive over the long haul.

title: Marketing Specialist, Interim
description:
We’re always looking for diverse, talented, service-oriented people to join our exceptional team.

Marketing Specialist, Interim

The pay range for this position is listed below. Our pay ranges are built to allow for candidates with various levels of skill and experience to be considered, as well as for room for growth and tenure achieved in a role over time. Typical new hire salary offers fall within the minimum to midpoint of a pay range for many candidates. Any offer extended to a candidate will be based upon their unique set of knowledge, skills, education, and experience as well as internal equity.

Pay Range:

$74,683.00 - $112,024.00

Scheduled Weekly Hours:

40

What You’ll Be Doing Under the direction of the Manager, Integrated Marketing, serve as the marketing liaison for branches and provide direction for branch marketing campaigns and organizational projects (including branch openings and relocations). Responsible for developing and implementing promotions and campaigns that support the Credit Union's Member acquisition, awareness, participation (usage), and retention efforts.

Serve as the primary point of contact for branches for marketing. Remains abreast of new ideas, practices, principals and techniques in integrated marketing and share and implements new practices in campaigns. Develops strong relationships with assigned areas by demonstrating strategic marketing expertise. Contributes to the marketing plans for his or her assigned areas of responsibility. Effectively evaluates new requests, insightfully interpreting their needs. Communicates marketing projects thoroughly and successfully to teammembers through written and oral communication anticipating Member and teammember questions and concerns. Participate in the brainstorm, development and execution of our unified branch marketing strategy of campaigns and promotions to attract new Members and drive participation and awareness in current and new markets. Studies the marketplace, data and competitive marketing to uncover opportunities and generate new ideas. Uses data to develop Member personas and uses journey mapping techniques to understand and improve their experiences. Conduct marketing research and analysis to identify opportunities, trends, and understand the competitive landscape, providing insights for informed decision-making. Responsible for the creation of branch opening and relocation communication strategies, ensuring a strong presence and successful launch in the new location. Partner with branch leadership to establish KPIs (“when the branch is considered ‘open’”) and communicate targets and strategy to Member Comms & Service Support. Collaborate with Member Comms & Service Support on communication strategy to support overall opening strategy and KPIs. Keep informed of Member Comms & Service Support plans for communications and report on progress to branch partners and stakeholders. Writes and edits copy for integrated marketing materials, demonstrating an ability to capture our brand tone of voice and use technically correct grammar. Writes thoughtful and inspirational briefs to coax on-brand creative from writers and designers. Monitor and analyze campaign results, response and Member feedback to continuously improve campaign performance. Manages the production of strategic marketing campaigns – including, but not limited to, print advertising, out-of-home (OOH), retail point-of-sale (POS), collateral, events, direct mail and email for integrated marketing and Member communications. Plan and oversee the installation of marketing artwork, collateral and equipment (plasmas, video walls) for branch openings and relocations, coordinating with appropriate business units. Brainstorm, plan and execute branch events (grand opening events for new and relocated branches, annual Open Houses, etc.). Manages the production of strategic marketing campaigns – including, but not limited to, print advertising, out-of-home (OOH), retail point-of-sale (POS), collateral, events, direct mail and email for integrated marketing and Member communications. Manages the inventory of marketing collateral by continually monitoring the stock mix and demands and proactively replenishing inventory. Serves as the marketing lead on branch-related organizational projects. Serves as the main point of contact for Branches and Membership Development for marketing support requests. Works with procurement to source promotional items for marketing campaigns and events. Directs internal teams or external vendors/agencies on the execution of assigned campaigns. Develop and maintain strong relationships with external partners, vendors, and agencies. Obtains competitive bids and estimates from agencies and vendors. Responsibly manage assigned marketing budget. Periodically conducts due diligence audits of print vendor pricing and service levels. Ensures campaigns are thoroughly tested and proofed to guarantee accuracy and quality. 

Additional Job Functions

Performs other duties as assignedComplies with regulatory compliance and assigned training requirements including but not limited to BSA regulations corresponding to their specific job duties. Failure to do so may result in disciplinary and other employment related actions

Qualifications

Bachelor's Degree or equivalent years of experience required3-5 years of previous related experience required

Knowledge, Skills, And Abilities

Demonstrates expertise in various integrated marketing channels – including, but not limited to, advertising, direct marketing, online advertising, email marketing, search engine marketing, website, merchandising and social media – and uses strategic thinking to recommend the appropriate mix for the marketing objective and target audience. Deeply understands how Members research, learn and ultimately choose their assigned product or service and uses that understanding to compose multichannel campaigns. Develops and manages timelines and displays strong organization and time management skills to handle multiple projects and campaigns at once, on time and within budget. Exhibits strong knowledge of financial services as well as deep understanding of Credit Union products and services and operations. Experience in financial services strongly preferredExcellent written and verbal communication skillsExcellent copywriting and editing skillsExcellent project/time management skillsCommitted to qualitySelf-motivatedFamiliarity with AP styleWorking knowledge of graphic designWorking knowledge of website content management systems, email application service providers, social media monitoring tools, and tag management

title: Mechanical Assembler (LPSD)
description:
Career Area

Operations

Job Description

 Your Work Shapes the World at Caterpillar Inc. 

When you join Caterpillar, you're joining a global team who cares not just about the work we do – but also about each other. We are the makers, problem solvers, and future world builders who are creating stronger, more sustainable communities. We don't just talk about progress and innovation here – we make it happen, with our customers, where we work and live. Together, we are building a better world, so we can all enjoy living in it.

Job Summary

The Mechanical Assembler is responsible for medium to heavy assembly which consists of installing critical engine components in a variety of engine systems or generator set components. The incumbent is also responsible for the assembly of large generator packages, wiring of control panels for the generator packages, and the construction of Canopy containers to house the generator packages.

Responsibilities

 Daily tasks and assignments are provided by normal routine leadership or working with established procedures.  Activities involve moderate system proficiency and data input  Normal routine adjustments with equipment and a normal level of problem identification and resolution are necessary in performing job.  Communicates effectively with inter/intra shift employees. Daily contact may also require a wide range of contacts within and outside the company. 

Basic Qualifications

 At least 6 months of previous manufacturing/mechanical experience  Experience with hand tools or various power tools (which could include wrenches, torques)  Experience with repairing parts 

Top Candidates Will Also Have

 One year of previous assembly or troubleshooting/repairing/operating equipment experience  Cat computer systems such as MES (basic skills/knowledge, capable of functioning independently)  The ability to work safely and maintain that focus throughout the day  Excellent communication skills as this position requires daily communication with supporting departments as needed to ensure their work is correct and accurate  Previous automotive experience  Previous maintenance experience  Experience reading and understanding factory orders, blueprints, schematics, work tickets, torque specifications.  Experience with standard work instructions (basic skills/knowledge, capable of functioning independently)  Experience with assembly requirements for all parts and assembly procedures (basic skills/knowledge, capable of functioning independently) 

Physical Requirements

 Candidates for all positions must have the ability to work in a fast pace, medium to heavy duty assembly, technical environment.  Work may involve frequent bending, stooping, and kneeling, twisting, turning, climbing, and standing on concrete for 10 hours.  All positions also require the ability to lift up to 25 lbs and withstand frequent repetitive movement of hands with a variety of tooling.  Some positions require the ability to perform tasks on a moving conveyor under time constraints. 

 Compensation & Benefits Offered! 

 40-hour work weeks with potential for Overtime  Multiple shifts offered - Shift premium of 10% per hour for 3rd shift  80 hours of vacation with an additional 40 hours of paid Personal Time Off (PTO)  10 Paid holidays  Climate controlled work environment – most areas  100% 401k match up to 6%  Annual company contribution into your 401k  Health, dental, vision, & life insurance  Quarterly bonus program  Clean/safe work environment  Paid holiday shut down at the end of the year (dependent upon business needs) 

Additional Information

 This position is located in Griffin, GA 

 Please ensure you frequently check the e-mail account you provided on your application, including the junk/spam folder, as this is the primary correspondence method in our recruiting process. 

Relocation assistance is not offered for this position.

title: Chauffeur Attendant
description:
DCAS's mission is to make city government work for all New Yorkers. From managing New York City’s most iconic courthouses and municipal buildings, to purchasing over $1 billion annually in goods and services for more than 80 City agencies what we do ensures that all agencies can deliver on their mission. Our reach touches every facet of city government and is instrumental to the successful day-to-day operations of the City of New York.

Our Commitment To Equity, Effectiveness, And Sustainability Guides Our Work Providing City Agencies With The Critical Resources And Support Needed To Succeed, Including

 Recruiting, hiring, and training City employees. Managing 55 public buildings. Acquiring, selling, and leasing City property. Purchasing over $1 billion in goods and services for City agencies. Overseeing the greenest municipal vehicle fleet in the country. Leading the City's efforts to reduce carbon emissions from government operations.

When you work at DCAS, you're not just working for one agency, but in service of them all. It's an opportunity to provide impactful support, quality customer service, and help protect the future of New York City for generations to come. Visit our website at nyc.gov/dcas to learn more about the work we do.

The Office of Transportation Services (OTS) within the Administration line of service of the Department of Citywide Administrative Services (DCAS) is responsible for managing a fleet of vehicles that are assigned to DCAS and the Office of the Mayor for use in the conduct of official City business, managing the delivery, registration, transfer, relinquishment and salvage of agency vehicles. Additionally, OTS directly manages the agency’s Chauffeur Attendants who are responsible for providing transport to senior level agency of Mayor’s Office staff.

The Office of Transportation Services is responsible for the following:

 Managing a DCAS fleet. Managing a Mayor's office fleet. Providing support, personnel and equipment for special events scheduled by City Hall. Providing personnel, equipment and vehicles for emergencies. Delivering new vehicles, transfers vehicle registrations, and monitors relinquishment and salvaging of replaced vehicles. Managing the agency car share program, which provides eligible agencies and personnel the opportunity to borrow a variety of vehicles for short term use.

The position of Chauffeur Attendant requires the utmost professionalism, discretion, dependability, and detailed knowledge of NYC thoroughfares. Chauffeur Attendants drive senior government officials and will be required to exhibit complete discretion and maintain absolute privacy regarding any information and issues discussed within the vehicle. As part of the responsibility of providing transportation services, Chauffeur Attendants are often required to work evenings and weekends and may be required to perform other related tasks as needed including but not limited to maintaining a clean vehicle, ensuring vehicles being operated are properly maintained and reporting any issues that may arise.

This position requires complete dependability, timeliness, and detailed knowledge of NYC. The candidate will be required to exhibit complete discretion and maintain absolute privacy regarding any information and issues discussed within the vehicle.

Minimum Qualifications

N/A

Preferred Skills

 NYS CDL License Preferred - 5+ years of experience as a Chauffeur - Knowledge of NYC Boroughs and driving routes

Public Service Loan Forgiveness

As a prospective employee of the City of New York, you may be eligible for federal loan forgiveness programs and state repayment assistance programs. For more information, please visit the U.S. Department of Education’s website at https://studentaid.gov/pslf/.

Residency Requirement

New York City residency is generally required within 90 days of appointment. However, City Employees in certain titles who have worked for the City for 2 continuous years may also be eligible to reside in Nassau, Suffolk, Putnam, Westchester, Rockland, or Orange County. To determine if the residency requirement applies to you, please discuss with the agency representative at the time of interview.

Additional Information

The City of New York is an inclusive equal opportunity employer committed to recruiting and retaining a diverse workforce and providing a work environment that is free from discrimination and harassment based upon any legally protected status or protected characteristic, including but not limited to an individual's sex, race, color, ethnicity, national origin, age, religion, disability, sexual orientation, veteran status, gender identity, or pregnancy.

title: Remote Sales Specialist
description:
Title:Life Underwriter
Summary:We are seeking a dynamic and motivated Life Underwriter to join our reputable insurance brokerage. As a Life Underwriter, you will be responsible for building strong relationships with clients, understanding their insurance needs, and providing tailored life insurance solutions. This is an exciting opportunity to join a forward-thinking company that values innovation, teamwork, and professional growth. We offer competitive compensation, comprehensive training, and a supportive work environment!
Responsibilities:- Build and nurture client relationships to understand their financial goals and insurance needs- Conduct thorough needs analysis and provide personalized life insurance recommendations- Educate clients on the various types of life insurance policies, including term, whole life, and universal life, and their benefits- Collaborate with clients to customize coverage options and ensure their specific needs are met- Assist clients in completing applications, collecting necessary documents, and submitting underwriting requirements- Follow up with clients throughout the sales process, addressing any questions or concerns- Maintain accurate client records and documentation in compliance with industry regulations and internal guidelines- Stay informed about industry trends, product updates, and changes in insurance regulations- Participate in ongoing professional development activities to enhance knowledge and skills in life insurance sales- Meet or exceed sales targets and contribute to the overall growth of the brokerage- Collaborate with a supportive team, sharing best practices and fostering a positive work environment
Qualifications:- Proven track record in sales, preferably in the life insurance industry- Life and Health Insurance License required- Strong interpersonal and communication skills, with the ability to establish trust and rapport with clients- Demonstrated ability to conduct comprehensive needs analysis and provide suitable insurance recommendations- Goal-oriented mindset with a drive to achieve sales targets and deliver excellent customer service- Up-to-date knowledge of industry trends, products, and regulations- Proficient in using CRM software and other sales tools to manage and track client interactions- Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail- Ability to work independently, as well as collaboratively within a team environment
Join our dynamic team and make a difference in the lives of our clients by providing them with the financial protection they deserve. Apply now to become a valuable member of our growing organization.

title: Associate Director of Commercial Advanced Analytics
description:
For Current Kite Pharma Employees and Contractors:

Please log onto your Internal Career Site to apply for this job.

At Kite, we empower our leaders to step up, share ideas, listen, learn, and lead. We’re welcoming bright, diverse, and imaginative minds; we’re nurturing them to foster an environment of inclusion and growth where innovation is encouraged. We expect our people leaders to model that environment, and to focus on creating inclusion, developing talent, and enabling teams.

Job Description

Everyone at Kite is grounded by one common goal – curing cancer. Every single day, we seek to establish a direct line between that purpose and our day-to-day work. Would you like to join us in this mission?

We are seeking a highly motivated individual to join Kite’s Advanced Analytics & Data Science team, within the Global Analytics and Commercial Operations (GACO) organization, as the Associate Director of Commercial Advanced Analytics. The Associate Director will be accountable for developing and delivering data-driven insights to support new product launch strategy, planning, and implementation, with a primary focus on Multiple Myeloma. Internally known as an Associate Director of Marketing Sciences, the Incumbent will collaborate closely across key business partners including Marketing, Sales, Market Access, Integrated Insights, Pipeline Analytics, Finance, and Business Operations, as well as our external collaboration partner to develop deep analytical capabilities and proactively identify opportunities to enhance Commercial effectiveness. Reporting to the Senior Director of Global Advanced Analytics and Data Science, this individual will play a critical role in optimizing commercial launch readiness, facilitating strategic implementation, and maximizing the impact of our products in the market.

To develop and foster meaningful connections with stakeholders, we would prefer that this candidate be located at Kite’s Santa Monica, California headquarters (3 days per week onsite required) and would provide a generous relocation package as necessary.

Key Responsibilities Include:

 Lead the analysis and synthesis of complex information, opportunity identification, and development of actionable conclusions and recommendations. Conduct in-depth market analysis to identify trends, opportunities, and competitive dynamics, providing actionable insights to inform commercial strategies and tactics. Develop first-hand knowledge of Commercial data sets and support stakeholders as a trusted subject matter expert to navigate emerging business needs and the evolving data landscape. Conduct hypothesis-driven investigations into detailed physician-level, patient-level and transactional-level data, to gain business insights from various customer perspectives (HCPs, patients, payers). Analyze the effectiveness of marketing campaigns, promotional activities, and sales initiatives, and provide recommendations for optimizing marketing spend and resource allocation to optimize ROI. Develop sophisticated analytical techniques (statistics, predictive models, machine learning capabilities, and AI) to enable commercial organization. Lead the establishment of data and advanced analytics capabilities for multiple myeloma disease area. Collaborate closely with other insights and analytics colleagues to bring an integrated approach to actionable insights Support launch decision making for Kite’s multiple myeloma asset including but not limited to developing analytics for field force sizing, physician segmentation, market tracking. Conduct ad-hoc advanced analytics to inform stakeholders on key business questions. Create, manage, and maintain expandable analytical models for recurring analyses.

Basic Qualifications:

Doctorate and 2+ years of experience

OR

Master’s degree and 8+ years of experience

OR

Bachelor’s degree and 10+ years of experience

OR

Associate degree and 12+ years of experience

OR

High School Diploma / GED degree and 14+ years of experience

Preferred Qualifications:

 Graduate degree in a quantitative field (Data Science, Engineering, Mathematics, etc.) or MBA with a bachelor’s degree in a quantitative field. 8+ years of experience with advanced data modeling and business intelligence techniques 6+ years of pharmaceutical or life sciences experience. Prior experience in oncology, hematology, and/or rare disease commercial or market access advanced analytics/data science. Ability to influence and nurture projects end-to-end through collaboration and foster thoughtful relationships as this role necessitates a high degree of proactive engagement with cross-functional stakeholders including Marketing, Sales, Commercial Operations, and Market Access. Possess a deep working knowledge of advanced analytical resources and approaches, an excellent customer focus, and the ability to thrive in an agile environment. Excellent programming experience in Python, R, or a similar language (ability to independently develop, test, and implement data programs). Excellent understanding of database structures, data wrangling, cleansing, and manipulation. Ability to independently conduct various statistical tests like correlation, decision tree, regression, random forest to predict and assess customer behavior in the disease treatment journey (HCPs, patients, etc.). Significant experience conducting analysis with large healthcare data sets (claims, EMR, etc.). Creative, thoughtful problem solving skills and intellectual curiosity and passion for asking and answering questions in large datasets. Ability to influence a cross-functional and diverse team and can adapt efficiently and independently in an agile environment. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.

Does this sound like you? If so, please apply today!

#IND123

The salary range for this position is: $173,910.00 - $225,060.00. Kite considers a variety of factors when determining base compensation, including experience, qualifications, and geographic location. These considerations mean actual compensation will vary. title: Implementation Manager
description:
Get started on an exciting career at Element!

Element employees make a difference in the lives of others every day. We are re-defining the fleet management industry to be people first, then business – delivering on our promise of a superior client experience. This takes hard work and innovation, and we need more like-minded people on our team.

As an Implementation Manager with Element, you will be responsible for continuous improvement of existing client onboarding process toward a best-in-class experience that delights our clients through its focus on surpassing client expectations in targeted implementation cycle times while maintaining the Element expertise in the process measured through business metrics around cycle times and satisfaction surveys.

Including Project mgmt., Stakeholder mgmt., Change mgmt.Lead and represent NBI as a Subject Matter Expert in cross-functional projects as requested by the business.Work with Sales and NBI Director on prospective client support to win business (RFP responses, sales presentations, etc.).Other duties as assigned.

title: Senior Transportation Planner
description:
Sam Schwartz, a TYLin Company, is a leading transportation engineering, planning, and environmental firm known nationally for our ability to solve complex transportation problems with creative, multi-modal solutions. Our work includes diverse, high-profile projects for both private and public sector clients. We are located in Los Angeles/Oakland, CA, Washington, DC, Chicago, IL, Jersey City, NJ, New York, NY, Seattle, WA and Tampa, FL.

Job Summary

Sam Schwartz is seeking a Senior Transportation Planner to join an interdisciplinary team of consultants (planners, graphic designers, data analysts, and transportation engineers) who can lead a variety of urban mobility projects such as neighborhood and corridor studies, bicycle/pedestrian/micromobility plans, parking and curbside management, transit plans, data analytics, and other types of projects in the New York City region and around the country.

Ideal candidates will be solutions-focused, with the ability to contribute significantly to conceptual design, problem solving, and report writing, will be client-facing, with the ability to communicate persuasively and develop positive team dynamics; and will have demonstrated experience managing complex projects, including the ability to understand and anticipate the larger client and business needs while successfully managing day-to-day project demands.

Responsibilities & Qualifications

Responsibilities will include:

Leading interdisciplinary project teams

Leading the development of technical reports and presentations

Analyzing transportation data and communicating results

Developing and applying innovative data analysis techniques

Managing projects, including tracking of budgets and schedules, and implementing QA/QC processes

Contributing to the maintenance of client relationships

Supporting business development initiatives and production of proposals

Occasional fieldwork and site visits

Skills And Qualifications

The ideal candidate will possess a combination of the following qualities:

5 to 10 years of urban planning experience

Degree in urban planning, urban design, or related field

Experience managing transportation projects, including management of staff, budgets, and clients

Excellent written and verbal communication skills

Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment

Understanding of, and interest in, marketing, networking, and business development

Familiarity with industry standards and best practices

Familiarity with Microsoft Office, ArcGIS, Adobe Creative Suite, and/or other industry software

AICP certification preferred

Additional Information

Sam Schwartz, a TYLin Company, is committed to pay equity. As part of that commitment, we have provided the base compensation range for this position, $87,800-$131,600 annually. We recognize that each candidate brings a unique set of skills, experience, education and competencies to the table that will be reflected in our offer. Sam Schwartz is proud to offer exciting career development opportunities.

Sam Schwartz Consulting, LLC offers a comprehensive total rewards package. Our benefits include extensive medical, disability and life insurance coverage, continuing education benefits, paid time off, employee assistance program and a retirement savings plan with company matching contributions.

We encourage all candidates to explore our total rewards offering.

Sam Schwartz Consulting, LLC is an equal opportunity employer, and we prohibit discrimination and harassment of any type as protected by federal, provincial, state or local laws. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. The company and its employees are required to comply with all local health authority, legal or lawful client requirements.

title: Civil Design Engineer - Solid Waste
description:
What We Are Looking For

SCS Engineers is looking for a Design Engineer to perform solid waste projects in work from either our West Palm Beach, FL or Coconut Creek, FL offices.

We are looking for a team player with a desire to develop professionally. You will prepare engineering calculations, drawings, reports, and permit applications and serve as the Engineer of Record on projects for public and private clients primarily in the South Florida market.

Responsibilities include engineering design, client communications, and staff coordination and development. Project responsibility will have a primary focus on solid waste management, including landfill gas, landfills and landfill infrastructure, composting, and other projects, which may require design, engineering, permitting, construction, and operations support.

You will report to the Project Director/South Florida Solid Waste Group Leader.

How You Can Make An Impact

Apply intensive and diversified knowledge of engineering and scientific principles and practices in solid waste assignment areas and related fields.Prepare engineering calculations, drawings, reports, and permit applications.Work independently on engineering or scientific problems and methods, plans and coordinates work, and represent SCS at meetings and conferences.Field work performed by high/driving in varied terrain and weather will be required, including but not limited to, surveys/data gathering, CQA liner installations, inspections, etc.Office based tasks including but not limited to: CAD drafting, mathematical calculations, report writing, creating site plans and facility diagrams, permit applications, etc.Business development including but not limited to: proposal preparation, meeting with clients, and attending industry related conferences/trade shows.Receives technical guidance on unusual or complex problems and supervisory approval on proposed plans or projects.

Qualifications

Florida P.E (preferably civil) registration required or ability to obtain reciprocity within 6 months.Bachelors degree in Civil Engineering, Environmental Engineering or Geotechnical Engineering required.Minimum of 8 years of relevant experience such as working knowledge and demonstrated consulting experience, business specific to the solid waste industry, including landfill gas management, air compliance, and landfill design and permitting, etc. required.Competent with using MS Office and other computer software normally used in environmental consulting. Experience using AutoCAD Civil 3D design software is a plus.Valid driver's license with a driving record in good standing required.

Whether it’s reducing methane emissions at agricultural facilities and landfills, repurposing contaminated properties, producing alternative energy, or sequestering carbon, we’ve been focused on finding smart climate solutions and improving the natural environment since our inception over 50 years ago. Join our 100% employee-owned firm and start creating your own legacy.

As a growing firm, we offer excellent opportunities for career advancement and a comprehensive package, including:

Medical, Dental, Vision, Life and Disability Insurance100% employer- funded Employee Stock Ownership Plan (ESOP) and 401K including employer match.Annual Bonus ProgramStudent Debt Employer Contribution ProgramPaid holidays and PTO

Pay range for this position is depending on experience and location. This does not include bonuses or our Employee Stock Ownership Plan.

title: Farm Hand (Clay Center, NE)
description:
Working Title Farm Hand (Clay Center, NE)

Description Of Work

The U.S. Meat Animal Research Center ( USMARC ) is a 34,000-acre facility near Clay Center, NE. All work performed at USMARC supports research that is focused on solving high priority problems for the U.S. beef, sheep, and swine industries.

As a Farm Hand, you will:

Perform all activities associated with irrigated forage crop production including but not limited to tillage, planting, chemical applications, irrigation and harvesting operations.Perform routine equipment maintenance and repair.Assist other operational areas including but not limited to livestock feeding and care, fence installation and repair, building /facility maintenance.
